title: The Baltimore plan
brief_description: Explains how a young social worker aroused the interest of citizens, government officials, and a local newspaper in the housing conditions in Baltimore’s slums. Describes the “Baltimore Plan” which made minimum housing standards a legal requirement and which created a Housing Court to enforce the laws. Shows how officials and citizens in Baltimore attacked the problem in selected areas. No other credits available.
